pr_title: [StorageQuota] Adding more logs to quota classes

timeline.bodyText: Could you add java doc for this method?
timeline.author: jsjtzyy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -71,4 +71,12 @@
    * @param mode The new value for {@link QuotaMode}.
    */
   void setQuotaMode(QuotaMode mode);
+
+  /**
+   * Interface of callback method when the quota of certain account and container's quota is exceeded.
+   */
+  interface QuotaExceededCallback {
+    void onQuotaExceeded(QuotaMode quotaMode, short accountId, short containerId, QuotaOperation op, long quota,

timeline.bodyText: I am thinking if we can move this to caller method and use separate metrics for AccountService and AccountStatsReport. Thus, we have a clear view that how may QPS from AccountService, how many from Account Stats/ Quota Service.
timeline.author: jsjtzyy

replies.bodyText: the metrics takes the store class as part of the metric name, so it's already separated.
replies.author: justinlin-linkedin

nit: try to avoid string concatenation in the log.

timeline.author: jsjtzyy

timeline.message: [StorageQuota] Adding more logs to quota classes

timeline.bodyText: in practice, rate metrics behave pretty similarly to count metrics (since count metrics are partitioned into count/sec by the metrics sensors). Is there a specific reason for having both?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: Didn't think counter does that. If so, i will remove the meter.
